title: International Financial Reporting Standards Disclosure Checklist

sections.title: Presentation of Financial Statements
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IAS 1.

items.question: Does the entity publish a document containing its financial statements?
items.original_question: Are the financial statements identified clearly (using an unambiguous title) and distinguished from other information in the same published document?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity publish a document containing its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the published document and ensure that it includes the financial statements (e.g., statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss, statement of cash flows, etc.). Confirm the existence of financial statements as required by IAS 1.

yes_case.question: Are the financial statements clearly identified using an unambiguous title such as 'Financial Statements' or a similar term?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the published document to verify that the financial statements are clearly identified and titled. The title should not cause confusion with any accompanying information, such as management reports or non-financial disclosures. Ensure compliance with IAS 1.49 and avoid general or misleading titles.

yes_case.question: Are the financial statements clearly distinguished from other information in the same published document?
yes_case.guidance: Check that the financial statements are presented in a separate section, or otherwise clearly segregated, so as not to be confused with other reports or disclosures in the same document. This distinction should be evident to the users of the document.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the period as part of a complete set of financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's reporting framework or governance documents (e.g., Annual Report or Audit Pack) to confirm if the entity prepares a complete set of financial statements under IFRS, as required by IAS 1.

yes_case.question: Does the entity include a statement of financial position as at the end of the reporting period in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Check the complete set of financial statements and verify the presence of the statement of financial position. It should detail the entity’s assets, liabilities, and equity as at the end of the reporting period, consistent with IAS 1 requirements.

items.question: Does the entity prepare a complete set of financial statements for the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity present a statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income for the period as part of a complete set of financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare a complete set of financial statements for the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements provided by the entity. A complete set must include (as per IAS 1.10) a statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, statement of changes in equity, statement of cash flows, and notes. Verify completeness by cross-checking the contents with IAS 1 requirements.

yes_case.question: Does the entity include a statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income as part of the complete set of financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the complete set of financial statements and confirm the presence of the statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income. Ensure the statement is clearly titled and includes required elements such as revenue, expenses, profit for the period, items of other comprehensive income, and total comprehensive income.

items.question: Does the entity prepare a complete set of financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity present a statement of changes in equity for the period as part of a complete set of financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare a complete set of financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review IAS 1.10, which specifies a complete set of financial statements includes the statement of financial position, profit or loss and other comprehensive income, statement of changes in equity, statement of cash flows, and notes. Ensure the entity has prepared all these components.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present a statement of changes in equity for the period?
yes_case.guidance: Verify that the complete set of financial statements contains the statement of changes in equity as required by IAS 1. Be cautious to ensure it includes at minimum the reconciliation of opening to closing balances of equity, showing comprehensive income, and transactions with owners in their capacity as owners (e.g., dividends).

items.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements for the period?
items.original_question: Does the entity present a statement of cash flows for the period as part of a complete set of financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements for the period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's documentation to confirm the presence of financial statements for the period. Verify the existence of a balance sheet, income statement, and other required components defined in IAS 1.10.

yes_case.question: Does the entity include a Statement of Cash Flows as part of its complete set of financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements to confirm that the Statement of Cash Flows is presented alongside other mandatory components specified in IAS 1.10, such as the balance sheet, income statement, statement of changes in equity, and notes.

items.question: Does the entity prepare a complete set of financial statements in accordance with IAS 1?
items.original_question: Does the entity present notes, comprising material accounting policy information and other explanatory information as part of a complete set of financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare a complete set of financial statements in accordance with IAS 1?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements. According to IAS 1.10, a complete set includes: a statement of financial position, a statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, a statement of changes in equity, a statement of cash flows, and notes comprising significant accounting policies and other explanatory information. Ensure all components are present.

yes_case.question: Do the notes to the financial statements include material accounting policy information as well as other explanatory information?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes section of the financial statements. Verify that material accounting policies are disclosed as per IAS 1.117, and that other explanatory information is provided as required by relevant IFRS standards (e.g., IAS 1.112(c)). Ensure disclosures are sufficiently detailed and relevant.

items.question: Does the entity prepare a complete set of financial statements as defined in IAS 1.10?
items.original_question: Does the entity present comparative information in respect of the preceding period as specified in IAS 1.38 and 38A as part of a complete set of financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare a complete set of financial statements as defined in IAS 1.10?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements provided by the entity and confirm that they include all required components under IAS 1.10: (a) a statement of financial position at the end of the period, (b) a statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income for the period, (c) a statement of changes in equity for the period, (d) a statement of cash flows for the period, (e) notes, including a summary of significant accounting policies, and other explanatory information, and (f) comparative information as per IAS 1.38 and 38A. Ensure completeness by cross-referencing with IAS 1, and check whether the entity meets these basic reporting requirements.

yes_case.question: Does the entity include comparative information in respect of the preceding period as specified in IAS 1.38 and 38A?
yes_case.guidance: Verify that the financial statements include comparative amounts for all amounts reported in the current period's financial statements, including narrative and descriptive information when applicable. Pay special attention to whether the comparative information complies with IAS 1.38 and 38A guidelines.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity prominently display the name of the reporting entity or other means of identification, and any change in that information from the end of the preceding reporting period, at least once in the financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Check whether the organization publishes financial statements in accordance with IAS standards. If applicable, review the financial statements for compliance with IAS 1 requirements.

yes_case.question: Are the financial statements prominently displaying the name of the reporting entity or another means of identification at least once?
yes_case.guidance: Check the cover page, title, or header of the financial statements for a clear indication of the entity's name or identification. Refer to IAS 1.51 for requirements regarding the identification of the reporting entity.

yes_case.question: Is there any change in the name or identification of the reporting entity from the end of the preceding reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Compare the name or other identifying information presented in the current financial statements with that of the prior period. If a change occurred, ensure the change is disclosed appropriately in accordance with IAS 1.51 and IAS 21.8.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the change in name or identification appropriately in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes or disclosures section in the financial statements to confirm that the change in name or identification is explained. Ensure it is clear, prominent, and meets IAS 1 disclosure requirements.

items.question: Do the financial statements exist?
items.original_question: Does the entity prominently display whether the financial statements cover the individual entity or a group of entities at least once in the financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Do the financial statements exist?
decision_tree.guidance: Verify whether the entity has prepared a complete set of financial statements in accordance with IAS 1. Refer to IAS 1.10 for the components of financial statements, such as the statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, etc.

yes_case.question: Do the financial statements include a statement specifying whether they cover an individual entity or a group of entities (e.g., consolidated financial statements)?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the introductory sections of the financial statements, titles, and notes section. Standard practice includes this information prominently either on the cover page, the opening statement, or within the general information section. Refer to IAS 1.51 for this requirement.

yes_case.question: Is this specification prominently displayed in the financial statements (i.e., easily noticeable without extensive searching)?
yes_case.guidance: Check the location and visibility of the specification (e.g., bold font, separate section, clear wording). Avoid assumptions based on indirect mentions in footnotes or obscure references. IAS 1 requires information to be presented prominently.

items.question: Do the financial statements include a date for the reporting period or the period covered?
items.original_question: Does the entity prominently display the date of the end of the reporting period or the period covered by the financial statements or notes at least once in the financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Do the financial statements include a date for the reporting period or the period covered?
decision_tree.guidance: Examine the cover page and introductory sections of the financial statements and notes. Check for the presence of the statement date or the reporting period (e.g., 'For the year ended December 31, 202X'). Ensure this information is explicitly stated at least once.

yes_case.question: Is the date of the reporting period or covered period prominently displayed in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Review where the date is mentioned. It must be clear and easily identifiable (e.g., as a distinct section, heading, or bold text). Ensure it is not buried in a footnote or obscured by other information.

items.question: Do the financial statements exist and are prepared in accordance with IFRS?
items.original_question: Does the entity prominently display the presentation currency, as defined in IAS 21.8, at least once in the financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Do the financial statements exist and are prepared in accordance with IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Ensure that the entity has prepared financial statements in compliance with IFRS standards. Review the entity's annual report or equivalent document to confirm IFRS compliance. Common pitfalls: Misinterpreting the accounting framework or overlooking IFRS references.

yes_case.question: Is the presentation currency defined and disclosed as required by IAS 21.8?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements or notes for explicit disclosure of the presentation currency. IAS 21.8 requires the entity to indicate the currency in which its financial statements are presented (e.g., USD, EUR). Avoid common issues such as assuming the functional currency is the same as the presentation currency without explicit mention.

yes_case.question: Is the presentation currency prominently displayed at least once in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Review all sections of the financial statements, particularly the introductory notes, primary financial statements, or accounting policies section. The presentation currency must be clearly indicated as per IAS 1.51. Ensure the display is prominent and easily identifiable for users of the financial statements.

items.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements for the current reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity prominently display the level of rounding used in the presentation of amounts in the financial statements at least once in the financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements for the current reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Verify the existence of financial statements for the current reporting period as required under IAS 1. Ensure that these statements include at least the Statement of Financial Position, Statement of Comprehensive Income, Statement of Cash Flows, and notes. If financial statements have not been prepared, this checklist item does not apply.

yes_case.question: Do the financial statements include numerical amounts?
yes_case.guidance: Review all sections of the financial statements and confirm the presence of numerical amounts (e.g., monetary values, percentages). If numerical amounts are absent, this checklist item is not applicable.

yes_case.question: Does the entity prominently display the level of rounding used in the presentation of amounts at least once in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the financial statements (typically in the notes or introductory section) for a statement specifying the rounding policy for numerical amounts (e.g., 'Figures are rounded to the nearest thousand'). Ensure this disclosure is clear and easily identifiable. Beware of hidden or vague references to rounding policies that do not meet the requirement for prominent display.

items.question: Is the entity's domicile disclosed anywhere in the information published with the financial statements?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the domicile of the entity?

decision_tree.question: Is the entity's domicile disclosed anywhere in the information published with the financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements, including notes and accompanying reports such as the annual report. Look for a clear mention of the entity's domicile (e.g., registered address, country of incorporation) in sections like the entity overview, management discussions, or legal disclosures. Ensure all sources of published information linked to the financial statements are considered.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose its domicile in the financial statement notes as required by IAS 1.138?
no_case.guidance: Focus on the notes accompanying the financial statements. Confirm that the domicile is disclosed as required by IAS 1.138, which mandates inclusion of the entity's registered office or primary location of operation if it has not been disclosed elsewhere.

items.question: Is the legal form of the entity disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the legal form of the entity?

decision_tree.question: Is the legal form of the entity disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review other sections of the annual report or documents accompanying the financial statements, such as governance reports, corporate details, or introductory notes, to check if the legal form of the entity is explicitly disclosed. The legal form can include descriptions such as 'Limited Company', 'Corporation', 'Partnership', etc. Ensure the information is accurate and clearly identifiable.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose the legal form of the entity within the financial statements?
no_case.guidance: Check the financial statement notes, introductory sections, or disclosures for the legal form of the entity. This disclosure may be included in sections such as Entity Information, Corporate Structure, or General Information. Ensure the text follows IAS 1.138 and is not vague or missing.

items.question: Has the entity published information about its country of incorporation elsewhere in documents accompanying the financial statements?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the entity's country of incorporation?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity published information about its country of incorporation elsewhere in documents accompanying the financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Check any documents published alongside the financial statements, such as the annual report or regulatory filings. Look for explicit mention of the entity's country of incorporation. Ensure the documents are part of the same reporting package and accessible to stakeholders.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose its country of incorporation within the financial statements themselves?
no_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements, especially the notes to the accounts or the general information section. The country of incorporation should be explicitly disclosed per IAS 1.138 requirements.

items.question: Has the entity published the address of its registered office or principal place of business elsewhere outside the financial statements?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the address of the registered office (or principal place of business, if different from the registered office)?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity published the address of its registered office or principal place of business elsewhere outside the financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review any information published alongside the financial statements, such as the annual report, company website, or regulatory filings. Check specifically for the address of the registered office or principal place of business. Ensure that the address is complete and accurate.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose the address of the registered office or principal place of business within its financial statements?
no_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements, particularly the notes and introductory sections. Look for any mention of the registered office or principal place of business. Cross-check with IAS 1.138 requirements, ensuring disclosure is presented clearly and prominently.

items.question: Is the entity required to prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the nature of the entity's operations and its principal activities?

decision_tree.question: Is the entity required to prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the entity's regulatory filing requirements or refer to the external auditor's report. Entities with public accountability (e.g., listed companies) or those opting to follow IFRS voluntarily will typically fall under this requirement.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of its operations and principal activities in the financial statements or elsewhere in published information (e.g., annual reports or other official publications)?
yes_case.guidance: Review the 'About the Entity' section, 'Management Discussion and Analysis', or similar sections in the financial statements or the associated published documentation. Common omissions relate to overly generic descriptions, lack of detailed principal activities, or failure to link disclosures back to its operations.

no_case.question: Does the entity provide such a disclosure elsewhere?
no_case.guidance: Check any other accompanying published information such as the annual report, investor presentations, or financial statement notes for disclosures about the entity's operations and principal activities. Ensure information is accessible and sufficiently detailed.

items.question: Does the entity have a parent company?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the name of the parent?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have a parent company?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the corporate structure of the entity in its annual report or other governance documentation. Check for any mention of a parent company, controlling entity, or group structure. Ensure that there is clear evidence of the existence of a parent company. If the entity is standalone and not part of a group, answer 'No'.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the name of the parent company in the financial statements or elsewhere in the published information?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements and accompanying disclosures (e.g., notes to the accounts). Also check other published documents, such as the annual report, investor relations materials, or regulatory filings, for the parent entity's name. If it is disclosed anywhere in these documents, answer 'Yes'.

items.question: Does the entity belong to a group controlled by an ultimate parent?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the name of the ultimate parent of the group?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity belong to a group controlled by an ultimate parent?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's organizational structure and ownership details in the financial statements or supporting documents. Verify whether the entity is a subsidiary or part of a larger group controlled by an ultimate parent. The ultimate parent is the top-level entity in the group that exercises control over subsidiaries.

yes_case.question: Is the name of the ultimate parent disclosed in the financial statements or any accompanying published information?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements and any accompanying reports (e.g., annual report, regulatory filings). The name of the ultimate parent must be disclosed either in the notes to the financial statements or other accompanying information. Ensure completeness and clarity.

no_case.question: If not disclosed in the financial statements, is the name of the ultimate parent disclosed elsewhere in published information accompanying the financial statements?
no_case.guidance: Investigate any other documents published alongside the financial statements, such as management commentary or sustainability reports. Ensure that the name of the ultimate parent is explicitly mentioned.

items.question: Is the entity a limited life entity?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose information regarding the length of its life (if the entity is a limited life entity)?

decision_tree.question: Is the entity a limited life entity?
decision_tree.guidance: Determine if the entity has a finite life as specified in its governing documents (e.g., articles of incorporation, partnership agreements, or other legal documents). A limited life entity is one that ceases to exist after a predetermined time or event. Verify this information in the entity's foundational documents.

yes_case.question: Is information regarding the length of the entity's life disclosed in the financial statements or elsewhere in information published with the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements (e.g., Notes) or accompanying reports such as the Annual Report. Look for explicit disclosure of the predetermined life span or duration of the entity. Common errors to check for include missing or unclear explanations.

items.question: Does the entity have particular transactions, other events, or conditions that impact its financial position or financial performance?
items.original_question: Does the entity provide additional disclosures if the requirements in IFRSs are insufficient to enable users to understand the impact of particular transactions, other events, and conditions on the entity's financial position and financial performance?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have particular transactions, other events, or conditions that impact its financial position or financial performance?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and accompanying notes, focusing on unusual items, significant transactions, or unique events (e.g., acquisitions, disposal of assets, revaluations, or changes in accounting estimates). Check for material uncertainties or atypical circumstances reported under IAS 1 or IFRS 5.

yes_case.question: Are the IFRS-mandated disclosures for these transactions, events, or conditions sufficient to allow users to understand their impact on the entity’s financial position and performance?
yes_case.guidance: Compare the disclosures in the financial statements to IFRS standards. Refer to IAS 1.112 for guidance on presentation and disclosure principles. Examine whether information gaps exist that could hinder user understanding. Ensure disclosures provide relevant, understandable, and comparable information.

no_case.question: Has the entity provided additional disclosures to address any gaps and ensure sufficient information about the impact of these transactions, events, or conditions?
no_case.guidance: Check whether supplementary disclosures have been added beyond the IFRS requirements, as prescribed by IAS 1.15 and IAS 1.17. These disclosures should improve clarity and enable users to fully understand the financial implications. Look for narrative explanations, quantitative disclosures, or other necessary details.

items.question: Has the entity prepared its financial statements in accordance with IFRSs?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose an explicit and unreserved statement of compliance with IFRSs?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity prepared its financial statements in accordance with IFRSs?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and related documentation to confirm they are prepared according to International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRSs). Check the basis of preparation note in the financial statements, typically found under 'Summary of Significant Accounting Policies'.

yes_case.question: Does the entity include an explicit and unreserved statement of compliance with IFRSs in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Search for a statement explicitly mentioning compliance in the financial statements. It should state, 'These financial statements comply with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRSs)' and must not have any reservations or qualifications.

items.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement due to management's conclusion that compliance would be misleading?
items.original_question: When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose that management concluded that the financial statements present fairly the entity's financial position, financial performance and cash flows?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement due to management's conclusion that compliance would be misleading?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements, accompanying disclosures, and any relevant management commentary to identify instances where compliance with an IFRS requirement was deemed misleading and a departure occurred. Ensure this decision aligns with the principles outlined in IAS 1.19 and IAS 1.20. Common pitfalls include failing to provide adequate justification for the departure or misunderstanding when departures are permitted.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed that management concluded the financial statements still present fairly the entity's financial position, financial performance, and cash flows?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements or relevant disclosures. IAS 1.19 explicitly requires this statement to justify a departure. Ensure the disclosure mentions 'fair presentation' and explains how compliance would have been misleading.

items.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement due to compliance being misleading?
items.original_question: When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose that it complies with applicable IFRS accounting standards, except that it departs from a requirement of an IFRS to achieve a fair presentation?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement due to compliance being misleading?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and accounting policies described in the notes. Look for explicit mentions of departures from IFRS requirements. Ensure the departure is justified by providing a fairer presentation and supported by sufficient reasoning.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed that it complies with applicable IFRS standards except for the departure?
yes_case.guidance: Verify whether the entity has clearly stated that it complies with IFRS except for the identified departure. Check the basis of preparation section and notes to the financial statements for this disclosure.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature, reason, and financial impact of the departure from the IFRS requirement?
yes_case.guidance: Ensure that the disclosure includes (a) the nature of the departure, (b) why compliance would be misleading, and (c) the financial impact of the departure. Check these disclosures against IAS 1.19-1.20 requirements in the notes or basis of preparation.

items.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement due to compliance being misleading?
items.original_question: When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS from which the entity departs?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement due to compliance being misleading?
decision_tree.guidance: Confirm if the entity has identified circumstances where compliance with an IFRS requirement would result in financial statements that are misleading. Refer to IAS 1.19 for guidance on when departure is permitted. Check relevant disclosures and meeting minutes for discussions on IFRS compliance.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the title of the IFRS requirement from which it has departed?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements, especially the notes. Ensure that the title of the specific IFRS requirement causing the departure is explicitly stated in the disclosures as required by IAS 1.20.

items.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement because compliance would be misleading?
items.original_question: When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose the nature of the departure?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement because compliance would be misleading?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and supporting documentation (e.g., notes to the financial statements, auditor's report). Look for explicit statements or justifications of departures from specific IFRS requirements and ensure there is evidence supporting the claim that compliance would result in misleading financial reporting. Verify against IAS 1.19 and IAS 1.20.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the departure, including the reason compliance would be misleading and the financial impact of the departure?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosures in the notes to financial statements. Specifically, the entity should disclose: 1) the nature of the departure, 2) the reasons why compliance with the IFRS requirement would be misleading, and 3) the financial impact of the departure. Ensure that this is clearly presented and easily understandable to users of the financial statements.

items.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement because compliance with it would have been misleading?
items.original_question: When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose the treatment that the IFRS would require?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement because compliance with it would have been misleading?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and disclosures. Look for explicit statements indicating departure from an IFRS requirement based on IAS 1.19 or IAS 1.20, which allow departure only if compliance would result in misleading financial reporting. Verify that such a departure is documented.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the treatment that the IFRS would require in addition to explaining why compliance would be misleading?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements. Ensure the entity explains the IFRS-required treatment and provides reasoning, supported by specifics, as to why compliance would be misleading. Review IAS 1.19 for detailed disclosure requirements.

items.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement because following the requirement would be misleading and conflict with the objectives of financial statements?
items.original_question: When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose the reason why that treatment would be so misleading in the circumstances that it would conflict with the objective of financial statements set out in the Conceptual Framework?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement because following the requirement would be misleading and conflict with the objectives of financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review disclosures in the financial statements and management commentary for explicit statements about a departure from an IFRS requirement. This typically occurs under very rare circumstances per IAS 1.19. Watch for notes or explanations regarding such departures and confirm their alignment with the Conceptual Framework's objective to provide useful financial information.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reason why compliance with the IFRS requirement would be misleading in the specific circumstances?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements or supplementary disclosures. The entity must explicitly state why compliance would conflict with the financial reporting objectives in IAS 1.19. Ensure the rationale is thorough and references the Conceptual Framework effectively.

items.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement because compliance would be misleading?
items.original_question: When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose the treatment adopted?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement because compliance would be misleading?
decision_tree.guidance: Assess the financial statements in detail, including management's disclosures, notes to financial statements, and accounting policies. Review the reasoning and documentation provided by management indicating that strict compliance with an IFRS would result in a misleading presentation. Cross-reference IAS 1.19 and IAS 1.20 for conditions under which departure from IFRS may be allowed.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the treatment adopted due to this departure?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the notes to financial statements for disclosures explaining the departure in compliance with IAS 1.20. Ensure the disclosure includes the nature of the departure, the treatment adopted, and why compliance would be misleading.

yes_case.question: Has the entity provided the details of the financial impact resulting from the departure?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosures in the financial statements to ensure the entity has quantified the effect of the departure, detailing how the financial position and performance have been impacted compared to compliance with the IFRS requirement. Confirm this aligns with IAS 1.20.

items.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement because compliance would be misleading?
items.original_question: When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose for each period presented, the financial impact of the departure on each item in the financial statements that would have been reported in complying with the requirement?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement because compliance would be misleading?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and disclosures, paying attention to the Basis of Preparation note. Check for explicit statements indicating departure from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance. IAS 1.19 states that departure is allowed in extremely rare circumstances when compliance would conflict with the true and fair presentation of financial statements.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the financial impact of the departure on each item in the financial statements for each period presented?
yes_case.guidance: Check the entity's disclosure notes. IAS 1.20 specifies that the entity must disclose the financial impact of the departure separately for each item affected in the financial statements, as well as for each reporting period presented. Ensure the disclosure is complete and provides sufficient detail for users of financial statements.

items.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period that affects current period amounts?
items.original_question: If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS from which the entity has departed?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period that affects current period amounts?
decision_tree.guidance: Review prior period financial statements and disclosures to identify any explicit departures from IFRS requirements. Examine if these departures have impacted the current period amounts. Be thorough with IAS 1.21 which allows such departures only if compliance would be misleading. Ensure there is a documented rationale and supporting details.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the title of the IFRS from which it departed?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements, particularly under disclosures related to accounting policies. Confirm that the title of the relevant IFRS is explicitly disclosed as per IAS 1.21 requirements.

items.question: Did the entity depart from an IFRS requirement in a prior period, affecting current period amounts?
items.original_question: If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose the nature of the departure?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity depart from an IFRS requirement in a prior period, affecting current period amounts?
decision_tree.guidance: Review prior period financial statements and disclosures for any notes indicating a departure from IFRS requirements. Also, assess the opening balances and transactions in the current period to determine if they were impacted by such departures. Verify this against IAS 1.21 and IAS 1.20.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the departure in accordance with IAS 1.21?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements in the current period. Ensure the nature of the departure is clearly described, including the reason for departure and its impact on current period amounts. Check that the disclosure complies with IAS 1.21.

items.question: Did the entity depart from an IFRS requirement in a prior reporting period?
items.original_question: If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose the treatment that the IFRS would require?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity depart from an IFRS requirement in a prior reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review financial statements, commentary notes, and disclosures for indications that the entity has deviated from IFRS requirements in any prior reporting period, impacting current period amounts. Pay attention to notes referencing unusual treatments or specific deviations. Consult IAS 1.20 for the criteria under which departures are permitted.

yes_case.question: Does the impact of the departure affect amounts reported in the current period’s financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine whether the departure in the prior period has implications on amounts presented in the current period (e.g., adjustments, restatements, or continuing impacts). Look for affected line items in the financial statements and notes discussing past deviations.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the treatment that would have been required by the IFRS standard, had the departure not occurred?
yes_case.guidance: Verify that the financial statements disclose sufficient information about the IFRS treatment that the entity would have applied. This should include details of the requirements of the IFRS standard, expected accounting impact, and reasons justifying the departure. Reference IAS 1.21 for disclosure requirements.

items.question: Did the entity depart from an IFRS requirement in a prior period, and does this affect current period amounts?
items.original_question: If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose the reason why that treatment would be so misleading in the circumstances that it would conflict with the objective of financial statements set out in the Conceptual Framework?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity depart from an IFRS requirement in a prior period, and does this affect current period amounts?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and disclosures, particularly the accounting policies and notes to the accounts. Look for any explicit mention of departure from IFRS requirements in prior periods that impact the current period amounts as per IAS 1.21 and IAS 1.20. Pay close attention to explanations in the notes section and audit reports. Ensure that such departure is clearly documented and not an oversight.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reason why departing from the IFRS requirement in the prior period was necessary to avoid misleading financial statement presentation, in line with the Conceptual Framework?
yes_case.guidance: Check the entity's disclosures and accounting policies to ensure the justification aligns with the Conceptual Framework objectives (e.g., faithful representation, relevance). Validate whether the entity explains why compliance with the IFRS requirement would conflict with these objectives and if sufficient detail is provided.

items.question: Did the entity depart from an IFRS requirement in a prior period, affecting current period amounts?
items.original_question: If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose the treatment adopted?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity depart from an IFRS requirement in a prior period, affecting current period amounts?
decision_tree.guidance: Review prior period financial statements and evaluate whether any IFRS requirement was intentionally not applied. Check for documented departures, such as notes in the audit reports or disclosure sections. Common pitfalls include overlooking footnotes that reference non-compliance or justified departures.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the treatment adopted in relation to the prior period departure and its impact on current period amounts?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statement disclosures for details explaining the departure, justification for departure (e.g., compliance with IAS 1.20 for fair presentation), and the methodology used to address the current period implications. Ensure clarity, completeness, and alignment with IAS 1.21.

items.question: Did the entity depart from an IFRS requirement in a prior period, resulting in an impact on current period amounts?
items.original_question: If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose for each period presented, the financial impact of the departure on each item in the financial statements that would have been reported in complying with the requirement?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity depart from an IFRS requirement in a prior period, resulting in an impact on current period amounts?
decision_tree.guidance: Review prior period financial statements and disclosures, particularly for any explicit statement of non-compliance or departure from an IFRS requirement. Analyze if such departure had consequences for current period amounts in the financial statements. Common pitfalls: overlooking minor departures or assuming compliance without adequate review.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed, for each period presented, the financial impact of the departure on each item in the financial statements that would have been reported in compliance with the requirement?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements and disclosures section. Ensure specific financial impacts on each item are detailed. Look for clarity and quantification of the effects, ensuring the relationship between the departure and reported amounts is well-documented. Missing or vague disclosures may indicate non-compliance.

items.question: Does the entity comply with all IFRS requirements, and has it taken no departures from IFRS standards?
items.original_question: When compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS in question?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity comply with all IFRS requirements, and has it taken no departures from IFRS standards?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and accompanying notes to determine if there is any indication of compliance issues or deviations from IFRS requirements. Check management commentary and auditor statements for mentions of non-compliance or departures.

no_case.question: Has the entity determined that strict compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading in their specific circumstances?
no_case.guidance: Verify whether management has provided documentation or rationale explaining why strict compliance would result in misleading financial statements. Review judgmental disclosures and management assessment reports.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the title of the IFRS requirement in question in the notes to the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the disclosure notes accompanying the financial statements to confirm the entity explicitly states the title of the IFRS that they believe would lead to misleading results. Ensure the rationale for the departure is clearly outlined.

items.question: Has the entity identified an IFRS requirement that it believes would be misleading if applied strictly?
items.original_question: When compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the nature of the requirement?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity identified an IFRS requirement that it believes would be misleading if applied strictly?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statement notes and disclosures. Look for any instances where management has expressed concern, either internally or externally, that compliance with a specific IFRS could lead to misleading financial information. Ensure this concern is documented and supported by an analysis of why the requirement is misleading in the context of the entity's operations.

yes_case.question: Is the entity prohibited from departing from the IFRS requirement?
yes_case.guidance: Review IAS 1.23 and IAS 1.20 for guidelines on departure. Determine whether the identified IFRS requirement allows any flexibility for departure under IAS 1, or if the standard mandates strict compliance with no exceptions to the rule.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the IFRS requirement and explained why compliance would be misleading?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statement disclosures specifically regarding the identified scenario. Check if the disclosure explains (a) the nature of the IFRS requirement, (b) why compliance would result in misleading information, and (c) any alternative approaches considered.

items.question: Has the entity determined that compliance with a specific IFRS requirement would be misleading in the circumstances?
items.original_question: When compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the reason why management concluded that complying with that requirement is so misleading in the circumstances that it conflicts with the objective of financial statements set out in the Conceptual Framework?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity determined that compliance with a specific IFRS requirement would be misleading in the circumstances?
decision_tree.guidance: Review management's considerations and documentation regarding compliance with IFRS requirements. This situation typically arises if complying with an IFRS requirement results in information that contradicts the objective of financial statements as outlined in the Conceptual Framework (e.g., relevance and faithful representation). Look for instances where management has explicitly identified this conflict.

yes_case.question: Is the entity prohibited from departing from the IFRS requirement under IAS 1.19?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to IAS 1.19, which outlines the conditions under which departure from IFRS is prohibited. Confirm whether departure is legally or regulatorily disallowed, or if there's significant stakeholder or jurisdiction pressure against departing.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reason why complying with the IFRS requirement would be misleading in the circumstances?
yes_case.guidance: Review explanatory notes in the financial statements and/or disclosures under IAS 1.23. Ensure a detailed explanation is provided describing why management believes compliance would conflict with the objectives set out in the Conceptual Framework, particularly focusing on relevance and faithful representation.

items.question: Has the entity identified an IFRS requirement that it believes would result in misleading financial statements if complied with?
items.original_question: When compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose for each period presented, the adjustments to each item in the financial statements that management concluded would be necessary to achieve a fair presentation?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity identified an IFRS requirement that it believes would result in misleading financial statements if complied with?
decision_tree.guidance: Review management's assessments and judgments regarding IFRS application. Check for any documented concerns where compliance with an IFRS requirement is deemed misleading while still being required by IFRS standards. For reference, see IAS 1.23 and IAS 1.20 for guidance on fair presentation.

yes_case.question: Has the entity departed from the IFRS requirement, even though departure is prohibited under IFRS?
yes_case.guidance: Evaluate whether the entity made any adjustments to IFRS-specific treatments to avoid the perceived misleading impact. Review disclosures and notes to the financial statements for indications of such departures.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose, for each affected period, the adjustments to each item in the financial statements necessary to achieve a fair presentation despite compliance?
no_case.guidance: Check the financial statement notes and disclosures for explicit explanations of adjustments made to ensure fair presentation. Verify that all affected periods are covered, and confirm completeness and accuracy.

items.question: Is the entity experiencing events or conditions that may cast significant doubt on its ability to continue as a going concern?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose material uncertainties related to events or conditions that may cast significant doubt upon the entity's ability to continue as a going concern?

decision_tree.question: Is the entity experiencing events or conditions that may cast significant doubt on its ability to continue as a going concern?
decision_tree.guidance: Review internal and external financial reports, budgets, and forecasts, including liquidity, solvency, and operational risks. Common indicators include recurring losses, significant debt, or adverse market conditions. Refer to IAS 1.25 for further examples of such uncertainties.

yes_case.question: Has the entity assessed these uncertainties and their impact on the ability to continue as a going concern?
yes_case.guidance: Verify that management has performed an assessment as required under IAS 1.25. This involves evaluating the severity and likelihood of the uncertainties impacting going concern status. Look for documentation such as written assessments, board meeting minutes, and auditor reports.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed material uncertainties related to its ability to continue as a going concern in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements, particularly disclosures near the 'Accounting Policies' or 'Going Concern' sections. Ensure that the disclosure adequately details the uncertainties, their nature, and any mitigating actions or decisions taken.

items.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
items.original_question: If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the fact that the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis?

decision_tree.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements and management's assessment in the directors' report or equivalent document. Check if any uncertainties or events cast doubt on the entity's ability to continue as a going concern. IAS 1.25 requires disclosure if the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis.

no_case.question: Does the entity clearly disclose that the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis?
no_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements for explicit disclosure explaining the basis of preparation. Ensure compliance with IAS 1.25, which mandates disclosure of the fact and reasons for not using the going concern basis.

items.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
items.original_question: If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the basis on which the financial statements are prepared?

decision_tree.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
decision_tree.guidance: Examine the accounting policy notes in the financial statements and management disclosures. A going concern basis assumes the entity will continue its operations for the foreseeable future, typically for at least 12 months. Check for any disclosed uncertainties, such as significant financial distress or adverse conditions, that may indicate the entity is not a going concern.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose the basis on which the financial statements are prepared?
no_case.guidance: Review the financial statements for explicit disclosure of the alternative basis (e.g., liquidation basis or other specific non-going concern assumptions). This disclosure should clearly articulate how assets and liabilities have been measured and other relevant assumptions used. Common pitfalls include omitting detailed explanations or using vague descriptions.

items.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
items.original_question: If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the reason why the entity is not regarded as a going concern?

decision_tree.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the accounting policies section of the financial statements or auditor's report for a statement indicating the basis of preparation. A going concern basis assumes the entity will continue operating for the foreseeable future. If there is no explicit mention, assess whether the entity's financial circumstances (e.g., insolvency, significant losses) suggest going concern issues.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose the reasons why it is not regarded as a going concern?
no_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements for explicit disclosure explaining the factors that indicate the entity is not a going concern (e.g., insolvency, inability to meet obligations, significant operational challenges). Refer specifically to IAS 1.25, which requires such disclosure in cases where the going concern assumption is not applied.

items.question: Has the entity changed the end of its reporting period, resulting in financial statements for a period longer or shorter than one year?
items.original_question: If the end of the entity's reporting period changes and the annual financial statements are presented for a period longer or shorter than one year, does the entity disclose: a. The reporting period covered by the financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity changed the end of its reporting period, resulting in financial statements for a period longer or shorter than one year?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and compare the previous reporting period to the current period. Check the Notes to the Financial Statements or the Statement of Financial Position for any indication of a change in reporting period length. Common changes may relate to mergers, acquisitions, or adjustments to align with parent company reporting periods.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the reporting period covered by the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the Notes to the Financial Statements or the introductory section of the financial reports. Ensure the entity explicitly states the period covered (e.g., 'For the 15-month period ended 31 March 2023' or 'For the 9-month period ended 30 September 2023').

items.question: Has the entity amended the presentation or classification of items in the financial statements?
items.original_question: If the presentation or classification of items in the financial statements is amended and comparative amounts are reclassified, does the entity disclose the nature of the reclassification?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity amended the presentation or classification of items in the financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and compare the presentation or classification of items between the current and prior periods. Look for changes in where or how items are categorized within the statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss, or other statements. Be cautious of subtle reclassifications not explicitly detailed.

yes_case.question: Have the comparative amounts been reclassified as a result of the amendment?
yes_case.guidance: Check if any amounts from the prior period are presented differently in the current period statements to align with the amended presentation or classification. Confirm that these reclassified amounts are adjusted for consistency.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the nature of the reclassification in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Verify disclosures in the notes to the financial statements. Look for a description of why the reclassification occurred and identify the specific impact on comparative amounts. Cross-check reclassification adjustments with the narrative provided.

items.question: Has the entity amended the presentation or classification of items in the financial statements?
items.original_question: If the presentation or classification of items in the financial statements is amended and comparative amounts are reclassified, does the entity disclose the amount of each item or class of items that is reclassified?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity amended the presentation or classification of items in the financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the current financial statements and compare them with the prior year's financial statements. Look specifically for any changes in how items are presented or classified. These changes might involve reorganization of line items, reclassification into different categories, or alterations in accounting policies. Refer to IAS 1.41 for details on presentation amendments.

yes_case.question: Have comparative amounts been reclassified as a result of the amendments to presentation or classification?
yes_case.guidance: Check whether the prior period comparative figures in the current financial statements have been adjusted to align with the new presentation or classification. This is typically required for consistency in financial reporting under IAS 1. If no adjustments appear, investigate whether the amendments to presentation or classification impact comparatives.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the amount of each item or class of items that is reclassified?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the notes to the financial statements or supplementary disclosures. IAS 1.41 requires entities to provide detailed information about the items or classes of items that were reclassified, including the nature and reasons for the reclassification. Ensure the disclosures are clear and sufficient for users of the financial statements to understand the changes.

items.question: Has the entity amended the presentation or classification of items in its financial statements compared to prior periods?
items.original_question: If the presentation or classification of items in the financial statements is amended and comparative amounts are reclassified, does the entity disclose the reason for the reclassification?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity amended the presentation or classification of items in its financial statements compared to prior periods?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the current period financial statements and compare them to the prior period financial statements. Look for changes in the way items are presented (e.g., new line items or regroupings) or classified (e.g., movement between operating, investing, or financing activities). Common pitfalls include missing subtle changes or overlooking notes describing reclassification adjustments.

yes_case.question: Have comparative amounts been reclassified to align with the amended presentation or classification?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statements for restated comparative figures corresponding to the amended presentation or classification. Check if these reclassifications are consistently handled across all affected items and financial periods. Refer to IAS 1.41 for requirements.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reason for the reclassification in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the notes to the financial statements for an explanation of why the reclassification was necessary. Ensure the explanation provides sufficient context and complies with IAS 1.41, which requires disclosure of the nature, amount, and reason for the change. Verify that the disclosure is clear and not generic.

items.question: Has the entity made changes to the presentation or classification of items in its financial statements for the reporting period?
items.original_question: If the entity cannot reclassify comparative amounts after making every reasonable effort to do so, does the entity disclose the reason for not reclassifying the amounts?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity made changes to the presentation or classification of items in its financial statements for the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and identify whether there are changes in presentation or classifications compared to prior periods. Compare line items in the current period with those in comparative periods to check for differences. Refer to IAS 1.41 for guidelines on changes in presentation.

yes_case.question: Was the entity able to reclassify the comparative amounts consistent with the current period's presentation, after making every reasonable effort to do so?
yes_case.guidance: Check the entity's effort to align comparative information with the current presentation. Review working papers and any disclosure notes explaining difficulties encountered in reclassification efforts. Consider if the effort was reasonable given the nature of the changes. Refer to IAS 1.42.

no_case.question: Did the entity disclose the reason for not reclassifying comparative amounts?
no_case.guidance: Examine the disclosure notes provided in the financial statements. Look for explicit mention of the reason why comparative amounts could not be reclassified. Ensure the reason is detailed enough to comply with IAS 1.42 requirements.

items.question: Has the entity made changes to the classification of an item within its financial statements in the current period?
items.original_question: If the entity cannot reclassify comparative amounts after making every reasonable effort to do so, does the entity disclose the nature of the adjustments that would have been made if the amounts were reclassified?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity made changes to the classification of an item within its financial statements in the current period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review current period financial statements and compare them to prior period statements. Look for any reclassification of items, such as movement between categories or changes in account grouping. The explanatory notes should provide details about these changes.

yes_case.question: Can the entity reclassify the comparative amounts for these changes in classification?
yes_case.guidance: Investigate whether adjustments have been made to prior period comparative amounts for consistent presentation, as required under IAS 1.42. If the entity is unable to do so, check its disclosures regarding the adjustments that would have been required for a reclassification.

no_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the adjustments that would have been made if the comparative amounts were reclassified?
no_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements. IAS 1.42 requires the entity to disclose the nature of adjustments needed to align comparative amounts with current period classifications, if reclassification was not possible.

items.question: Has the entity prepared a complete set of financial statements in the current reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity present, as a minimum, two statements of financial position, two statements of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, two separate statements of profit or loss (if presented), two statements of cash flows and two statements of changes in equity, and related notes?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity prepared a complete set of financial statements in the current reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Ensure that the entity has prepared a complete set of financial statements as outlined in IAS 1.10, including: a statement of financial position, a statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, a statement of changes in equity, a statement of cash flows, and notes to the financial statements. Verify this using the document for the reporting period being reviewed.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present, at a minimum, two comparative periods for each required financial statement?
yes_case.guidance: Check whether the entity presents a minimum of two statements of financial position (end of current and preceding period), two statements of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, two statements of cash flows, two statements of changes in equity, and the accompanying notes, as required by IAS 1.38A. Cross-reference both the financial statements and the notes to confirm compliance. Be cautious about errors in ensuring comparability across periods.

items.question: Does the entity voluntarily present comparative information in addition to the minimum required by IFRSs?
items.original_question: When an entity voluntarily presents comparative information in addition to the minimum comparative financial statements required by IFRSs, does the entity present related note information for those additional statements?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity voluntarily present comparative information in addition to the minimum required by IFRSs?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and disclosures. Check if the entity has provided comparative information for more periods than mandated by IAS 1 (usually one comparative period). If only the minimum comparative period is provided, this item is 'Not Applicable'.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present related note information for the additional comparative financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the accompanying notes to the financial statements. Ensure that any voluntarily included additional comparative figures have corresponding detailed notes explaining amounts and balances. Be thorough in inspecting additional disclosures as per IAS 1.38C.

items.question: Do the circumstances described in IAS 1.40A apply to the entity?
items.original_question: In the circumstances described in IAS 1.40A, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the current period?

decision_tree.question: Do the circumstances described in IAS 1.40A apply to the entity?
decision_tree.guidance: Review IAS 1.40A to determine if the entity is required to present a third statement of financial position. This applies when there is a retrospective application of a significant accounting policy, a retrospective restatement, or a reclassification with a material effect on the financial statements. Confirm this by analyzing the financial statements and the notes section for disclosures of changes in accounting policies, prior period errors, or reclassifications.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the current period?
yes_case.guidance: Check if there is a third statement of financial position accompanying the financial statements. It should show the financial position as at the start of the earliest comparative period when material changes outlined in IAS 1.40A exist. Carefully examine the disclosure notes and presentation format to ensure this is included.

items.question: Do the circumstances described in IAS 1.40A apply to the entity?
items.original_question: In the circumstances described in IAS 1.40A, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the preceding period?

decision_tree.question: Do the circumstances described in IAS 1.40A apply to the entity?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and check IAS 1.40A. Determine if the entity has made retrospective restatements or reclassifications of items, or if it has voluntarily changed accounting policies which result in the presentation of a new statement of financial position. Refer to the disclosures and notes in the financial statements.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the preceding period in addition to the current period?
yes_case.guidance: Verify that the financial statements include a third statement of financial position, often labeled as 'Statement of Financial Position as at the Beginning of the Earliest Comparative Period'. Check compliance with paragraph IAS 1.40B.

items.question: Does the entity have a situation as described in IAS 1.40A requiring a third statement of financial position?
items.original_question: In the circumstances described in IAS 1.40A, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the beginning of the preceding period?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have a situation as described in IAS 1.40A requiring a third statement of financial position?
decision_tree.guidance: Review IAS 1.40A for specific circumstances that require a third statement of financial position. These include retrospective application of an accounting policy, retrospective restatement of items in the financial statements, or reclassification of items in the financial statements, having a material effect on the information presented. Inspect the notes, accounting policies section, and prior period adjustments for signs of any of these circumstances.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the beginning of the preceding period (third statement), in addition to the end-of-period and comparative period statements?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the inclusion of a third statement of financial position (opening balance sheet) in the financial statements. Review IAS 1.40B for presentation requirements. Ensure it is positioned appropriately and the relevant disclosures accompany this statement.

items.question: Is the entity required to present an additional statement of financial position in accordance with IAS 1.40A?
items.original_question: When an entity is required to present an additional statement of financial position in accordance with IAS 1.40A, does the entity disclose the information required by IAS 1.41–44 and IAS 8?

decision_tree.question: Is the entity required to present an additional statement of financial position in accordance with IAS 1.40A?
decision_tree.guidance: Review IAS 1.40A to determine if the entity meets the conditions. An additional statement of financial position is required if the entity makes a retrospective application of an accounting policy, retrospective restatement, or reclassification of items in its financial statements that has a material effect. Examine changes in accounting policies under IAS 8, prior period errors, or reclassifications outlined in the financial statements and disclosures. Consult both the financial statements and notes for relevant changes.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the information required by IAS 1.41–44 and IAS 8 in connection with the additional statement of financial position?
yes_case.guidance: Check whether the entity discloses the following: (1) the reason for the additional statement (e.g., material retrospective application, restatement, or reclassification); (2) details of changes in affected line items; and (3) reconciliation of corresponding figures, including comparative amounts. Refer specifically to IAS 1.41–44 for disclosure of material adjustments and IAS 8 for changes in accounting policies and errors. Review accompanying notes to the financial statements thoroughly.

items.question: Does the entity present an opening statement of financial position in accordance with IAS 1.40A?
items.original_question: When an entity presents an opening statement of financial position in accordance with IAS 1.40A, is the date of this statement the beginning of the preceding period even if additional comparative information is presented in terms of IAS 1.38C?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity present an opening statement of financial position in accordance with IAS 1.40A?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements to confirm if the entity presents a third statement of financial position at the beginning of the preceding period. This might occur if there is a retrospective restatement or reclassification impacting the financial statements significantly as per IAS 1.40A.

yes_case.question: Is the date of the opening statement of financial position the beginning of the preceding period?
yes_case.guidance: Verify that the opening statement of financial position is dated at the start of the preceding period. For example, if the current period is the year ending on December 31, 2023, the opening statement date should be January 1, 2022. Ensure additional comparative information, if presented, is in accordance with IAS 1.38C.

yes_case.question: Does the additional comparative information comply with disclosure requirements of IAS 1.38C?
yes_case.guidance: Review whether any additional comparative information presented is relevant and in accordance with IAS 1.38C requirements. The additional information should align with the disclosure requirements for comparatives under IAS 1.
